perturbation.original_text: You will maintain during the term of this Agreement, and preserve for the time period specified by us, full, complete, and accurate books, records, and accounts in accordance with the standard accounting system prescribed by us from time to time in writing.  You will retain for a period of three (3) years all books and records related to the Franchised Restaurant, including without limitation, sales checks, purchase orders, invoices, payroll records, customer lists, check stubs, sales tax records and returns, cash receipts and disbursement journals and general ledgers.
perturbation.changed_text: You will maintain during the term of this Agreement, and preserve for the time period specified by us, full, complete, and accurate books, records, and accounts in accordance with the standard accounting system prescribed by us from time to time in writing. You will retain all books and records related to the Franchised Restaurant for a period of one (1) year, including without limitation, sales checks, purchase orders, invoices, payroll records, customer lists, check stubs, sales tax records and returns, cash receipts and disbursement journals and general ledgers.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text reduces the record retention period to one year. This contradicts standard accounting practices and potentially violates federal and state regulations that often require businesses to keep financial records for longer periods (e.g., for tax purposes, audits).
perturbation.contradicted_law: IRS regulations and state tax laws regarding record retention requirements.

perturbation.original_text: If we determine, in our sole discretion, that you or your manager is unable to satisfactorily complete the required training program, you will have thirty (30) days to provide an alternate person to complete the training program at your sole expense.  At least three (3) persons actively involved in the management and operation of the Franchised Restaurant must successfully complete the training program.  If you fail to provide three (3) persons who can complete the training program, we will have the right to terminate this Agreement and you will not be entitled to a refund of any portion of the franchise fees paid.
perturbation.changed_text: If we determine, in our sole discretion, that you or your manager is unable to satisfactorily complete the required training program, you will have ten (10) days to provide an alternate person to complete the training program at your sole expense. At least three (3) persons actively involved in the management and operation of the Franchised Restaurant must successfully complete the training program. If you fail to provide three (3) persons who can complete the training program, we will have the right to terminate this Agreement and you will not be entitled to a refund of any portion of the franchise fees paid.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time to provide an alternate person for the training program to ten (10) days may be considered an insufficient timeframe, especially considering logistical challenges (travel, scheduling). Some state franchise laws protect franchisees from unreasonable termination conditions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state franchise laws regarding fair termination practices.

perturbation.original_text: We shall give you written notice of our election not to renew the franchise at least three (3) months prior to the expiration of the initial or first renewal term of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: We shall give you written notice of our election not to renew the franchise at least one (1) month prior to the expiration of the initial or first renewal term of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for non-renewal to one month contradicts franchise laws in many states, which often require longer notification periods (e.g., 90 days, 120 days) to provide franchisees adequate time to prepare for the end of the franchise relationship.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State franchise laws regarding non-renewal notification periods (e.g., California Franchise Relations Act).
